content: pattern inspired by lgbtq+ pride kippah/yarmulke by stephen g krueger made for jvp bay area sizes small 5 5 medium 6 6 large 8 5 recommended yarn knit picks wool of the andes sport or any sport weight yarn colors red green 2nd green or white black tools 6 stitch markers optional needle requested by fellow jvper for high holy days generally the pattern is knit from the outside edge and relies on multiples of 6 to evenly decrease s/m sizes begin with the same number of stitches medium just has more k all row to fill it out large is much closer to the original pattern inspiration adjusted for sport weight yarn/needles block to have less/more curve as needed as an added bonus consider making seedless watermelon kippahs and letting recipients sew their own seeds in ❤️ this pattern is free please consider making a donation to www mecaforpeace org/donate
